TITLE: Environmental group staffers say it's a ‘nightmare’ to go to work
SUMMARY: Current and former employees at Defenders of Wildlife referred to the group as a "motorized revolving door" where morale is low and turnover is high.

TITLE: Justice or overreach?: As crucial test looms, Big Greens are under fire
SUMMARY: The environmental movement embraces a broad array of progressive causes while its own agenda hangs in the balance.

TITLE: FEMA flood program could violate civil rights law
SUMMARY: An investigation by POLITICO's E&E News reveals discrimination against people of color and low-income households. But alleged civil rights violations would be difficult to prove in court.

TITLE: Australia commits to reducing greenhouse emissions by 43%
SUMMARY: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said legislation to enshrine the new target in law would be introduced to the new Parliament.

TITLE: Floodwaters wash away houses in Yellowstone
How SCOTUS’ upcoming climate ruling could defang Washington
SUMMARY: A legal fight over the EPA’s power to restrict greenhouse gases offers conservative justices an opportunity to tie the executive branch's hands on a host of issues — from Covid to net neutrality.

TITLE: Rules at risk
SUMMARY: These are kinds of regulations that may fall under a legal cloud after the Supreme Court decides on an EPA climate change case.

TITLE: Gas prices reach $5, but Americans are still hitting the road
SUMMARY: The amount of gasoline being pumped into U.S. cars and trucks hit a three-year high this month.

TITLE: Biden moves to ease trade turmoil threatening his solar energy ambitions
SUMMARY: The moves come as the solar energy industry has been roiled by a Commerce Department probe into whether companies in four Southeast Asian countries have circumvented the tariffs on Chinese shipments of solar equipment to the U.S.

TITLE: ‘Slow-walked or watered down’: Friendly fire strafes Biden’s climate office
SUMMARY: Top domestic climate adviser Gina McCarthy says she is "leaving no stone unturned" to meet President Joe Biden's goals. Her office's critics say it's producing interference and delay.

TITLE: OPEC+ agrees to pump more oil ahead of possible Biden Middle East trip
SUMMARY: The White House offered measured praise for the move, giving credit to Riyadh for acknowledging tight market conditions and pushing OPEC members to boost their production.

TITLE: House Republicans to introduce climate change strategy with eye on midterms
SUMMARY: The strategy released by House Republicans contains few new policy ideas.

TITLE: Spiking temperatures could cause more blackouts this summer. They won't be the last.
SUMMARY: This summer’s anticipated tight grid conditions are just the tip of the iceberg as weather grows increasingly unpredictable and the U.S. aims to electrify more high-emitting sectors of the economy.

TITLE: America's next wind powerhouse: The Gulf of Mexico?
SUMMARY: The Gulf Coast's long reign as a hub for oil and gas production could help it secure a lead role in generating wind electricity and green hydrogen. But it will face some big obstacles.

TITLE: Allegations of industry influence rock mine safety commission
SUMMARY: A newly obtained memo outlines a Republican commissioner's use of a "Network" of inside and outside advisers when weighing personnel matters at the Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission.

TITLE: Strange Bedfellows: Farmers and Big Greens square off against Biden and the GOP
SUMMARY: White House support for an “interstate CO2 highway system” is scrambling alliances in Iowa.

TITLE: How FEMA helps white and rich Americans escape floods
SUMMARY: An investigation by POLITICO's E&E News reveals systemic favoritism toward wealthy and white people in a federal program that lifts homes above rising floodwaters.

TITLE: Supreme Court rejects red states' plea to block Biden climate metric
SUMMARY: The decision means the White House can move forward with its plans to overhaul and likely significantly increase the number known as the social cost of carbon.

TITLE: Granholm 'bullish' on Congress passing clean energy tax credits
SUMMARY: The clean energy tax credits were included in Democrats' broad budget reconciliation package that collapsed in the Senate last year.

TITLE: Biden's other gas price quagmire
SUMMARY: Natural gas prices have tripled since January, adding more fuel to the inflation plaguing the White House's popularity.

TITLE: House Democrats press DOJ to probe Trump Interior secretary for permit reversal
SUMMARY: Lawmakers allege that David Bernhardt pressured career staff at the Fish and Wildlife Service to reverse their denial of a water permit requested by a Trump donor.
